We have been using the box for several weeks =
now and have had some startling results.=A0 Our result=A0do=A0in fact=A0see=
m to be in direct correlation with the case we're working on.=A0 I have als=
o experienced words coming from the box, that seem to be repeating people i=
n the room.=A0 The first time I used the box my eleven year old son burst i=
nto the room to asked what we were having for dinner.=A0 I replied "There's=
 roast beef in the oven", the box said "beef", very clear and distinct.=A0 =
On another level, while recording the sessions, we were able to pick up ful=
l sentences with many voices all speaking at once.=A0 These were captured t=
he same way you would capture voices during EVP sessions using a digital re=
corder.=A0 If anyone would like to hear samples of these I will be more tha=
n happy to send a few to you.=A0 I prefer not to post them on esnips at thi=
s time as they are from a case I am currently working on.

--- On Wed, 11/12/08, John Frick <jfri=
ck45@atlanticbb .net> wrote:

From: John Frick <jfrick45@atlanticbb .net>
S=
ubject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The latest.
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com
Date: Wednes=
day, November 12, 2008, 2:32 PM





Frank, what you are doing with the box=
es is interesting. I think the draw to the box for ghost hunters is that it=
 "appears" to be a communication device with the dead. I've been experiment=
ing a lot with the radio shack hack box and I have been getting a lot. For =
the most part I am using it to get answers to questions I or others have in=
 areas that have had strange events or just a paranormal nature to them. Th=
ere is definitely communication at a rudimentary level although I doubt tha=
t all of it is=A0honest communication. I definitely see a lot of the tricks=
ter influence with these boxes. It can and does tell people what they want =
to hear, and it seems to be reading the minds of the participants. Like som=
eone will crack a joke and the box will respond 2 seconds later saying simp=
ly "joke". I was using the box in one area with a recently married woman an=
d the word pregnant came=A0out of the box=A03 times during the 2 sessions. =
I think the box was picking up on
 her conscious or subconscious thoughts. =
I have not gotten the word pregnant since then. 
=A0
So far both radio shac=
k types I have are working spectacularly for me. One of the more interestin=
g responses I've gotten out of the box is that it has said "ovulous" backwa=
rds (it said "75" forwards), and that was just 10 minutes or so after I was=
 playing around with the Ovilus. I don't know exactly how The Ovilus is sup=
posed to be pronounced but the box pronounced it like I spelled it above.
=
=A0
So what is going on with these boxes is extremely interesting and not r=
eadily explainable by science, but I lean away from thinking the communicat=
ions are coming from ghosts or demons, I am thinking it is just transferrin=
g thought into messages or it is higher beings answering our questions (alt=
hough not always truthfully). I have to say I was highly skeptical that I w=
ould get anything with these type of boxes but I have been fascinated by th=
e results. I've played what I am hearing for others and have done sessions =
with others, and these people have all been impressed too. Thanks for bring=
ing this technology to the forefront like you have.
=A0
=A0
=A0
=A0

----- =
Original Message ----- 
From: Frank Sumption 
To: Group 
Sent: Wednesday, N=
ovember 12, 2008 1:17 PM
Subject: [EVP-ITC] The latest.



=A0I know, doesn=
't fit the latest ghost hunting theories, and it has been poor at attrackin=
g the lime lights, but here it is. 
=A0
=A0I have played with the idea of a=
dding in a tone to act as a foundation for the ghost voices in the boxes, i=
t seems to works.the first example is on my site, http://purplealieng irl.t=
ripod. com/=A0, noted which one it it there. The second attempt was wiht bo=
x 24, but the tuner was som noisy I kinda gave up on that box. 
=A0
=A0In t=
his test I used two tones, guessing, about 800hz, and around 1khz. The tone=
s are mixed with the radio audio. The exact frequency is not all the import=
ant, as these are square waves, which contain all harmonics. This=A0is manu=
al sweep only, the sweep circuit is not build yet. 
=A0
=A0My approach is t=
esting and developing, I don't try to sell this stuff at this point, and=A0=
I can't make boxes for very many requesters, I just don't have the time. I'=
ve said it a thousand times, the box is not the only method, there are many=
 related methods of using raw audio.=A0This group has turned into more of a=
 ghost hunters group, something I don't agree with. 
=A0
=A0Frank-S

<table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0" ><tr><td valign="top" style="font: inherit;">I would be interested in getting them.   Seems the subject is quickly shifting.  Maybe it is best to begin questioning the source of jthe messages we receive?   ron<BR><BR>--- On <B>Wed, 11/12/08, suzanne bibb <I><suzyq6819@...></I></B> wrote:<BR>
<BLOCKQUOTE style="PADDING-LEFT: 5px; MARGIN-LEFT: 5px; BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid">From: suzanne bibb <suzyq6819@...><BR>Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The latest.<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com<BR>Date: Wednesday, November 12, 2008, 11:44 AM<BR><BR>
<DIV id=yiv1562859733>
<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<DIV>
<TABLE cellSpacing=0 cellPadding=0 border=0>
<TBODY>
<TR>
<TD vAlign=top>
<DIV>We have been using the box for several weeks now and have had some startling results.  Our result do in fact seem to be in direct correlation with the case we're working on.  I have also experienced words coming from the box, that seem to be repeating people in the room.  The first time I used the box my eleven year old son burst into the room to asked what we were having for dinner.  I replied "There's roast beef in the oven", the box said "beef", very clear and distinct.  On another level, while recording the sessions, we were able to pick up full sentences with many voices all speaking at once.  These were captured the same way you would capture voices during EVP sessions using a digital recorder.  If anyone would like to hear samples of these I will be more than happy to send a few to you.  I prefer not to post them on esnips at this time as they are from a case I am currently working
 on.</DIV>
<DIV> </DIV>
<DIV>Suzanne May</DIV>
<DIV>Director</DIV>
<DIV>MI Metro Paranormal Society<BR><BR>--- On <B>Wed, 11/12/08, John Frick <I><jfrick45@atlanticbb .net></I></B> wrote:<BR></DIV>
<BLOCKQUOTE style="BORDER-LEFT: rgb(16,16,255) 2px solid">From: John Frick <jfrick45@atlanticbb .net><BR>Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] The latest.<BR>To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups .com<BR>Date: Wednesday, November 12, 2008, 2:32 PM<BR><BR>
<DIV id=yiv2051485009>
<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<DIV>
<DIV><FONT face=Arial size=2>Frank, what you are doing with the boxes is interesting. I think the draw to the box for ghost hunters is that it "appears" to be a communication device with the dead. I've been experimenting a lot with the radio shack hack box and I have been getting a lot. For the most part I am using it to get answers to questions I or others have in areas that have had strange events or just a paranormal nature to them. There is definitely communication at a rudimentary level although I doubt that all of it is honest communication. I definitely see a lot of the trickster influence with these boxes. It can and does tell people what they want to hear, and it seems to be reading the minds of the participants. Like someone will crack a joke and the box will respond 2 seconds later saying simply "joke". I was using the box in one area with a recently married woman and the word pregnant came out of the box 3 times during the 2
 sessions. I think the box was picking up on her conscious or subconscious thoughts. I have not gotten the word pregnant since then. </FONT></DIV>
<DIV><FONT face=Arial size=2></FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2></FONT> </DIV>
<DIV><FONT face=Arial size=2>So far both radio shack types I have are working spectacularly for me. </FONT><FONT face=Arial size=2>One of the more interesting responses I've gotten out of the box is that it has said "ovulous" backwards (it said "75" forwards), and that was just 10 minutes or so after I was playing around with the Ovilus. I don't know exactly how The Ovilus is supposed to be pronounced but the box pronounced it like I spelled it above.</FONT></DIV>
<DIV><FONT face=Arial size=2></FONT> </DIV>
<DIV><FONT face=Arial size=2>So what is going on with these boxes is extremely interesting and not readily explainable by science, but I lean away from thinking the communications are coming from ghosts or demons, I am thinking it is just transferring thought into messages or it is higher beings answering our questions (although not always truthfully). I have to say I was highly skeptical that I would get anything with these type of boxes but I have been fascinated by the results. I've played what I am hearing for others and have done sessions with others, and these people have all been impressed too. Thanks for bringing this technology to the forefront like you have.</FONT></DIV>
<DIV><FONT face=Arial size=2></FONT> </DIV>
<DIV><FONT face=Arial size=2></FONT> </DIV>
<DIV><FONT face=Arial size=2></FONT> </DIV>
<DIV><FONT face=Arial size=2></FONT> </DIV>
<BLOCKQUOTE style="BORDER-LEFT: #000000 2px solid">
<DIV style="FONT: 10pt arial">----- Original Message ----- </DIV>
<DIV style="BACKGROUND: #e4e4e4; FONT: 10pt arial"><B>From:</B> <A title=purplealiengirl@... href="mailto:purplealiengirl@..." target=_blank rel=nofollow>Frank Sumption</A> </DIV>
<DIV style="FONT: 10pt arial"><B>To:</B> <A title=evp-itc@yahoogroups.com href="mailto:evp-itc@yahoogroups.com" target=_blank rel=nofollow>Group</A> </DIV>
<DIV style="FONT: 10pt arial"><B>Sent:</B> Wednesday, November 12, 2008 1:17 PM</DIV>
<DIV style="FONT: 10pt arial"><B>Subject:</B> [EVP-ITC] The latest.</DIV>
<DIV><BR></DIV>
<DIV id=ygrp-text>
<DIV> I know, doesn't fit the latest ghost hunting theories, and it has been poor at attracking the lime lights, but here it is. <BR> <BR> I have played with the idea of adding in a tone to act as a foundation for the ghost voices in the boxes, it seems to works.the first example is on my site, <A href="http://purplealiengirl.tripod.com/" target=_blank rel=nofollow>http://purplealieng irl.tripod. com/</A> , noted which one it it there. The second attempt was wiht box 24, but the tuner was som noisy I kinda gave up on that box. <BR> <BR> In this test I used two tones, guessing, about 800hz, and around 1khz. The tones are mixed with the radio audio. The exact frequency is not all the important, as these are square waves, which contain all harmonics. This is manual sweep only, the sweep circuit is not build yet. <BR> <BR> My approach is testing and developing, I don't try to sell this stuff at this point,
 and I can't make boxes for very many requesters, I just don't have the time. I've said it a thousand times, the box is not the only method, there are many related methods of using raw audio. This group has turned into more of a ghost hunters group, something I don't agree with. <BR> <BR> Frank-S<BR><BR>
